input_text:
Job Title: Strategic Partnerships Lead

Location: Austin, TX

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Business Development, Sales

Description:
Company Description

A bit about Wise:

Since 2011, we‚Äôve had a clear mission: money without borders. Built by and for people who live global lives, we‚Äôre the fairest, easiest way to manage your money across borders.

We‚Äôre just at the beginning of our story and we‚Äôre growing at an incredible pace, already moving ¬£27bn of international payments for customers and partners each quarter (and more than half of that instantly!). We won‚Äôt stop until anyone, anywhere can send, spend and receive money wherever they are, whatever they‚Äôre doing. There‚Äôs still heaps to do and we can‚Äôt do it alone.

Our People

At Wise, you‚Äôll be joining a movement of people who believe in a better, fairer, more transparent way of moving money around the world. You‚Äôll collaborate to do your best work and take on problems that no one has looked at before.

If you‚Äôre keen to learn, grow, try new things and aren‚Äôt afraid of a bold plan, you‚Äôll fit right in.

How We Work

At Wise our strategy emerges from the collective brainpower of all our people, who are organised in dozens of independent, autonomous teams. Teams stay closest to our customers, so they choose what problems to solve and where to spend the most time.

You‚Äôll experience radical levels of ownership and empowerment within your role. Plus the opportunity to see the direct impact of your work on our customers.

Job Description

Strategic Partnership Lead

$250,000-280,000 + RSU + Benefits

We‚Äôre looking for an energetic, Strategic Partnerships Lead for North America, who is passionate about the Wise mission ‚Äì money without borders. You‚Äôll be a part of the Wise Platform team, helping deliver world class payment service solutions to our partners and their customers, powered by the Wise infrastructure.

We‚Äôve launched partnerships globally, with the likes of Google Pay, Aspire, Mercury, EQ Bank and Mandiri, and today have 80+ global banks and platforms connected and powered by Wise Platform. We‚Äôre looking for a strategic partnerships leader with a track record of experience working with the largest Banks and Financial Institutions in North America, to take Wise Platform partnerships to the next level.

A Bit About The Role

The role is based in our Austin office, but you will also work closely with the Regional North America and Global Wise Platform teams based in our offices around the world. You will also work closely with other functions, including product management, compliance & legal, implementation and engineering.

You will be a senior leader of our GTM team in North America, owning key opportunities with the largest banks and financial institutions, driving initiatives to expand Wise Platform‚Äôs capabilities and building out Wise‚Äôs enterprise expansion footprint in North America.

Your Mission

Understand and help other teams understand in detail the existing and planned payments infrastructure in the U.S. and Canada, and frame our payments strategy to provide the best cross-border payments services to our platform partners in North America. Work with the Wise Platform team to build, close and deliver a strong pipeline of bank and financial institution partnerships in North America, driving product innovation, revenue and volume growth for WiseDevelop and execute the growth strategy for Wise Platform‚Äôs partner portfolio, brand footprint and cross-border payments market share in North AmericaCollaborate closely with other Wise teams like engineering and compliance to develop and enhance Wise product capabilities in North America through new integrated partnership opportunitiesWork on projects and initiatives to improve our strategy and approach both within the NorthAm region and globally, such as helping iterate our product roadmap, pricing strategies, go to market efforts - or anything else that helps drive growth

A Bit About You

Able to independently negotiate the most ideal terms with a clear product vision and understanding in mind and you can figure out the ideal operational and commercial process with every new partner.You‚Äôre hands on - happy to lead your own discussions as well as supporting our business development team with their pipelinesYou‚Äôre a natural leader - able to contribute to the build and development of a high performing bank vertical team, defining a clear plan with the team and quickly adapting as neededYou‚Äôre as comfortable technically - helping a partner solution the best way to use Wise Platform as you are discussing commercial and legal terms You‚Äôre business-minded - and have worked with multiple operational teams in the past to grow a business unit holisticallyYou‚Äôre analytical - data driven on where the team should be spending time and on scoping, sizing, prioritising and driving opportunitiesYou have a strong head for economics - being responsible for owning and supporting financial negotiations with partners to meet regional revenue goalsYou are Mission-driven and customer-focused - looking for synergistic partnerships that will benefit the customer and contribute to the Wise Mission

Some Extra Skills That Would Be Awesome

Worked in a high growth payments technology environment previously or have had a broad focus across multiple partnerships streamsBe familiar with the financial services and regulatory landscapes in North America and understand how the remittance landscape/international payments work today

What You Get Back

üöÄ RSU's in a rapidly growing company üí™ An annual self-development budgetü©∫ Medical, dental, & vision insurance ‚Äì including HSA and FSA optionsüíù Company-paid: Life Insurance, Short & Long-Term Disability, and an EAP programüíª Hybrid working model ‚Äì a mix of working from home and from the office‚úàÔ∏è Wisers can work remotely for 90 days a year. By ‚Äòremote‚Äô we don‚Äôt just mean from home, but from wherever in the world you choose toüåç Relocation expenses covered‚òÄÔ∏è 25 days PTO, 15 sick days, 11 holidays, 5 compassionate leave days, 3 paid ‚ÄúMe‚Äù days and a paid volunteer day, annuallyüèùÔ∏è A paid 6-week sabbatical leave after four years üë∂üèº 18-weeks of paid parental leave, after a year with usüí∞ 401k with up to a 4% employer matchüèÜ 2023 Austin BuiltIn Best Award winner for Best Places to Work and Best Large Places to Work

Find out more about our benefits in our Austin location.

We‚Äôre people without borders ‚Äî without judgement or prejudice, too. We want to work with the best people, no matter their background. So if you‚Äôre passionate about learning new things and keen to join our mission, you‚Äôll fit right in.

Also, qualifications aren‚Äôt that important to us. If you‚Äôve got great experience, and you‚Äôre great at articulating your thinking, we‚Äôd like to hear from you.

And because we believe that diverse teams build better products, we‚Äôd especially love to hear from you if you‚Äôre from an under-represented demographic.

Additional Information

For everyone, everywhere. We're people building money without borders ‚Äî without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive.

We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.

Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to contribute towards our mission and able to progress in their careers.

If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.

Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level

output_json.title: Strategic Partnerships Lead
output_json.summary: Join Wise, a global fintech company, as a Strategic Partnerships Lead to help deliver world-class payment service solutions to partners and their customers.
job_responsibilities: Understand and help other teams understand the existing and planned payments infrastructure in the US and Canada.
Frame Wise Platform's payments strategy to provide the best cross-border payments services to platform partners in North America.
Own key opportunities with the largest banks and financial institutions in North America.
Drive initiatives to expand Wise Platform's capabilities and build out Wise's enterprise expansion footprint in North America.
Develop and execute the growth strategy for Wise Platform's partner portfolio, brand footprint, and cross-border payments market share in North America.
Collaborate closely with other Wise teams like engineering and compliance to develop and enhance Wise product capabilities in North America through new integrated partnership opportunities.
Work on projects and initiatives to improve Wise's strategy and approach both within the NorthAm region and globally.
output_json.travel_requirements: Regular travel to Wise offices around the world and collaboration with teams in different regions.
benefits: RSUs in a rapidly growing company
Company-paid: Life Insurance, Short & Long-Term Disability, and an EAP program
Remote option for up to 90 days a year
Paid 6-week sabbatical leave after four years
18-weeks of paid parental leave after a year with the company
401k with up to a 4% employer match
2023 Austin BuiltIn Best Award winner for Best Places to Work and Best Large Places to Work
output_json.company_information: Wise is a global fintech company founded in 2011 with a mission to provide fair, easy, and transparent international money transfers.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: Wise is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion.

other.content: Wise values teams that are diverse, equitable, and inclusive. They celebrate their differences and aim to create a respectful and empowering work environment for all employees.
